alert.note: Alert for Eastern Kiowa County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Kiowa County through 300 PM MDT... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Brandon, or 24 miles northeast of Lamar, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sheridan Lake, Chivington and Brandon. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
